description: Dive into "Albufeira's Coastal Bliss: Beachside Escapes" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Albufeira's Coastal Bliss: Beachside Escapes

places.generalDescription: Marina de Albufeira is a vibrant and recently developed area located just a short distance from the main areas of Albufeira. The marina's buildings are painted in different candy colors, creating a distinctive and memorable sight. It serves as the departure point for boat trips along the coast, offering opportunities to explore caves or spot dolphins. Additionally, it's a great place to spend time with family and friends.

sources.snippet: Albufeira Marina was my next destination, a little away from the city. What surprised me the most was not the marina itself, but the colorful houses next to it. I still thought about going to Ponta da Baleeira, next to the marina, but I ended up deciding not to go.
sources.shortName: 13 Best Beaches in Albufeira | Algarve

sources.snippet: But it‚Äôs Albufeira‚Äôs beaches that have given it international renown. They are all different, each with their own charm. The variety is huge and starts in the west at Salgados Beach with its white sand dunes.
sources.shortName: Albufeira and the beaches | www.visitportugal.com

places.name: Marina de Albufeira

reviews.text: Very unusual area for yachts and waterspouts. Colourful apartment blocks and a huge long walkway with many bars either side abd covered seating. Definitely worth a visit! An hours walk from the old town along the esplanade or get a tuk tuk. The little train goes to it also.
A great day spent at this wonderful Marina, first an amazing boat trip to see the Benagil caves & Dolphins with Oceaneye and then a really tasty meal at one of many great restaurants.

Albufeira Marina is a charming and picturesque spot that's perfect for a leisurely stroll or a relaxed meal with a view. The sight of the docked boats against the backdrop of colorful little houses creates a vibrant and unique atmosphere, making it a great place for photos.

Beyond the scenery, the marina offers plenty of dining options, whether you're in the mood for casual bites or a coffee with a view. There are also fun game caf√©s and activities for kids, making it a family-friendly stop in your Albufeira itinerary.

Whether you're stopping by for a boat tour, a sunset drink, or just to soak in the views, Albufeira Marina is a lovely place to unwind and enjoy the coastal charm of the Algarve.

places.address: 3PMP+58, V√°rzea da, Beco da Orada Apartado 2422, 8201-918 Albufeira, Portugal

places.generalDescription: Praia da Fal√©sia is a picturesque beach located in the Algarve region, between Vilamoura and Albufeira. It features stunning red cliffs and golden sands, making it an ideal spot for sunbathing and water activities. The area offers a diverse range of tourism-related activities including a marina, golf courses, a casino, discos, tennis club, diving club, and other leisure facilities. Despite being popular, the beach is spacious enough to find privacy.

sources.snippet: This long straight strip of sand 8km (5 miles) east of Albufeira offers one of the region‚Äôs most impressive first glimpses of the coast as you descend from the clifftop parking lot. It‚Äôs backed by stunning cliffs in white and several shades of ochre, gouged by weather into intriguing shapes and topped by typical pines. While lovely at any time of day, around sunset, you‚Äôll see the cliffs light up in fiery hues as the rocks appear to glow from within.
sources.shortName: 10 of the best beaches in the Algarve, Portugal

sources.snippet: This isn‚Äôt just one of the most beautiful beaches near Albufeira, but regularly pops up on lists of the most beautiful beaches in the world. The 6km (4mi) beach is one of the longest in the country and is defined by its bright-red cliffs topped with pine trees that tower over golden sands and clear blue waters. The beach also takes its name ‚Äì which translates as ‚Äúbeach of cliffs‚Äù ‚Äì from these colourful cliffs.
sources.shortName: The Most Beautiful Beaches In Or Near Albufeira Portugal

sources.snippet: This one-of-a-kind beach stretches for more than six kilometres from Vilamoura westwards to Olhos de √Ågua near Albufeira Ã∂ accompanied around half of the way on the Albufeira side by steep ravishing red cliffs peppered with pine trees and pretty flowers. The west side near Albufeira is home to several luxury hotels which capitalise on the dramatic cliffside views and this section is known as A√ßoteias, while the east side nearer Vilamoura is referred to as Alfamar and here the cliffs are much lower, the beach is wider and the water is shallower, making it more suitable for kids Ã∂ you can dive and surf, while beachside restaurants offer sumptuous seafood and sundowner cocktails.
sources.shortName: 10 of the best beaches in the Algarve

sources.snippet: At almost 6 Km, Praia da Fal√©sia is the longest Albufeira beach and extends from Olhos d‚Äô√Ågua, on the east side of the city, to the municipality of Vilamoura. No matter where you access this beach, it will blow your mind away. The contrast between the dark red and white sandy cliffs topped by green pines against a blue sky is incredibly beautiful and makes it one of the most unique beaches in Albufeira.
sources.shortName: 7 Most Beautiful & Best Beaches in Albufeira

sources.snippet: Praia da Fal√©sia, known for being one of the most visited beaches in Albufeira, stretches over 6km, with the sea‚Äôs intense blue. This beach holds the Blue Flag award, a symbol of environmental quality and safety, and provides access for people with reduced mobility. In summer, it hosts various cultural and sporting events that attract visitors from around the world.
sources.shortName: The 7 best beaches in Albufeira, the Algarve

sources.snippet: Praia da Fal√©sia is perhaps the most beautiful of all Albufeira beaches. Best known for its impressive red cliffs, Fal√©sia Beach is located east of Albufeira and stretches for over 6 kilometers, all the way from Olhos de Agua to Vilamoura. The beach is flat and spacious, perfect for a long walk or a day of sunbathing.
sources.shortName: 9 BEST Beaches in Albufeira (+Map, Photos & Insider Tips)

sources.snippet: Praia da Falesia is wide and long, making your first glimpses from above even more impressive. Its cinnamon-colored cliffs are a breathtaking contrast against the green sea below. I arrived in the late afternoon just in time for golden hour, and it‚Äôs one of my favorite memories of the Algarve.
sources.shortName: Best Algarve Beaches: 10 Stunning Beaches Of Portugal‚Äôs Algarve

sources.snippet: Praia da Fal√©sia is one of the most beautiful beaches of Albufeira and actually the entire Algarve. This beach stretches for 6 kilometres and is backed by impressive rock formations in the west. Most tourists that come here for the first time have never seen anything like it.
sources.shortName: Albufeira Beaches You Should Visit During Your Holiday [Updated]

sources.snippet: Praia da Fal√©sia is one of the most popular beaches in the Algarve, attracting thousands of visitors every year. The sunset parties that are organised on this beach every Thursday afternoon during summer months attract many people looking for a fun way to celebrate summer.
sources.shortName: Top 25 most beautiful beaches in Algarve, Portugal

sources.snippet: It‚Äôs one of the most stunning beaches in Algarve and all of Portugal. It‚Äôs also one of the longest in the region and with some of the best hotels. It‚Äôs found below magnificent red Grand Canyon-like cliffs and there are breathtaking views from above.
sources.shortName: Top 20 ALBUFEIRA BEACHES - The Best and Most Beautiful 2024

sources.snippet: Praia da Fal√©sia is the huge stretch of sand that runs east to Vilamoura. EVA buses run out to Praia da Fal√©sia from Albufeira Bus Station in Cali√ßos from 8.05 am-5.35 pm (20 minutes).
sources.siteName: Portugal Visitor Travel Guide To Portugal
sources.shortName: Albufeira Beaches
Beaches in Albufeira

places.name: Praia da Fal√©sia

reviews.text:
This beach is absolutely breathtaking ‚ù§Ô∏è
The long stretch of golden sand, framed by stunning red and orange cliffs, feels like something out of a postcard.
There's so much space to walk, relax, or just take in the views - especially magical during sunrise or sunset. The contrast of the cliffs, pine trees, and ocean is unforgettable.

It's one of those beaches that makes you stop and say, ‚ÄúWow, this is paradise.‚Äù ü§©

I loved this place. Such a chilled out beach, when we went it was at 19¬∞ c in the water, which is really nice compared to cascais. Both times we were able to go in the water fine and the waves weren't that aggressive.

We also went to that little bar in the picture, price was fairly accessible and the beers were freezing.

A beautiful natural beach with stunning views. There is a man renting sunbeds (2 for ‚Ç¨19) for the day and it is worth it. Even with the tide in you can still use the beach, and the walk along the coast was lovely.  If you want to go to a beach with loads of activities close by this is not the beach for you, but if you want something basic but beautiful this is a great place.

There is a small town about 10 mins walk with restaurants, shops etc if you need anything.

places.generalDescription: Praia da Rocha Baixinha, also known as Praia da Falesia, is a stunning beach located in Vilamoura, Portugal. It features long stretches of golden sand and deep blue waters that are perfect for swimming. The beach is popular among visitors and has a lifeguard on duty. Situated near the marina, it offers a beautiful backdrop of cliffs.

sources.snippet: This peaceful beach to the eastern end of Fal√©sia Beach is perhaps better known by its nickname ‚ÄúPraia dos Tomates‚Äù thanks to the tomato plants growing by one of the entrances. The beach is split into two parts ‚Äì the east and the west, both of which have a Blue Flag rating. The western part of the beach sits next to the mouth of the River Quarteira and the upmarket resort town of Vilamoura lies on the other side.
sources.shortName: The Most Beautiful Beaches In Or Near Albufeira Portugal

sources.snippet: Boasting more than six kilometres of golden sand, stretching from Vilamoura in the west to Olhos do Agua in the east, Praia da Falesia is home to one of the longest beaches in Portugal. This sleepy residential town is known by the locals as 'beach town' and has managed to preserve something of its traditional Portuguese lifestyle. Backed by cliffs ( falesia is Portuguese for cliff) decorated with pine trees the beach is...
sources.shortName: 26 of the Best Beaches in Albufeira

sources.snippet: Translated to ‚Äòbeach of cliffs‚Äô, Praia da Falesia is located to the west of Albufeira and is known for its spectacular red cliffs and stunning views. It is a long stretch of sand that reaches as far as Vilamoura which means it is always possible to find a quiet spot, away from the crowds, to relax and soak up the sun. There are water sports here including paragliding, diving and a surf school.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches Near Albufeira to Visit

sources.snippet: The last beach in Albufeira before you reach Vilamoura is both a party beach and a beach for peace and quiet. On the eastern side it has a couple of bars and restaurants, water sports rentals and parasols and loungers, while the western end merges with Praia da Fal√©sia and is for those looking to relax and admire the natural scenery. Where to Stay: AP Adriana Beach Resort
sources.shortName: Top 20 ALBUFEIRA BEACHES - The Best and Most Beautiful 2024

sources.snippet: Praia de Falesia is a huge 6km beach of perfect sand and gentle rolling waves. It stretches all the way from the town of Vilamoura in the east to Olhos de Agua village. It is just a 15-minute drive from Albufeira and is a great choice for those looking for a more empty beach experience.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches in Albufeira, Algarve - Hidden Gems & Must-Visit Spots

sources.snippet: Praia da Rocha Baixinha is the easternmost beach of Albufeira, with white sand and plenty of entertainment. The beach bars here host several parties during summer. From the beach you can see Vilamoura, which is just east of the beach.
sources.shortName: Albufeira Beaches You Should Visit During Your Holiday [Updated]

sources.snippet: A long, stretching golden beach with stunning views all around. The cliffs are high here and act as a windbreaker, so great for sunbathing. Very popular with locals, especially among young adults.
sources.shortName: Best Albufeira Beaches - Top Tips, Advice & Information

sources.snippet: Praia da Olhos de Agua and praia da Falesia: beautiful beaches along the cliffs where you can see the fishermen at work.
sources.shortName: Albufeira: beaches, things to do and recommended hotels
Beaches in Albufeira

places.name: Praia da Rocha Baixinha

reviews.text: Wow beautiful rock formations and colours. A nice walk along the beach and there are some good viewpoints at the top, especially at the West end at Miradouro da Fal√©sia, you can stare down the entire beach from the top
Beautiful beach! Very child friendly area. Prices for sun beds are 20‚Ç¨ . Ok snack bars and not too many beach sellers yelling around your ears!

A perfect Algarve summer spot! ‚òÄÔ∏è Praia da Rocha Baixinha is exactly what you dream of for a beach day - soft golden sand, clear waters, and a lively summer vibe. Even in peak season, the atmosphere is relaxed and full of energy. Absolutely one of the must-visit beaches in the Algarve!

places.generalDescription: Praia do Barranco das Belharucas is a serene sandy beach with cliffs in the backdrop, offering sunbed rentals, lifeguards, and refreshment vendors. Accessible by car via a dirt road, parking can be limited during peak times. Alternatively, visitors can reach the beach from Falesia Lookout or take an adventurous path from Caminho di Deposito.

sources.snippet: This beautiful beach of Barranco das Belharucas is only accessible by car by following a dirt road, which leaves little chance of parking spaces in the end. In high season it is advisable to get there from the Fal√©sia Lookout, near the Riu Guarana hotel, and then descend along a steep path, or try the adventure by car by taking this path from the Caminho di Deposito, east of Olhos d'Agua. A very thin strip of sand, also fine, which gives the impression of a cove, without really being one, because if the walk is blocked towards Olhos d'Agua you can reach the other beaches of Falesia by following the shoreline.
sources.shortName: The beaches around Albufeira

sources.snippet: It is a distant, isolated beach with cliffs and mounds of sand as far as the eye can see. Any bird can be found on the islands: ponds and swamps in the region are home to an abundance of birds and are quite suitable for those who love to enjoy nature's beauty and birds in particular. It has pretty safe beaches with sound waves that are ideal for surfing and snorkelling, which makes it possible for people of any age or skill level to engage in water activities.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Best Albufeira Beaches for Your Seaside Getaway

sources.snippet: Praia do Barranco das Belharucas is at the West side of Fal√©sia beach. The beach has a beautiful cliff overlooking the sea which is home to a special type of bird called belharucas, or European bee-eaters. The beach is quite difficult to get to, you must follow a dirt track, or you can access it via the Sheraton Pine Cliffs Hotel if you are a guest there.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches in Albufeira

sources.snippet: Heading towards Vilamoura, you‚Äôll find this beautiful, long, wide beach with a few restaurants dotted along the way. A quieter beach than many in the area, and well worth a visit to see the beautiful contrasting colours or the cliffs, sea and sand. This is one of the reasons why photographers from all over the world visit the beach.
sources.shortName: Best Albufeira Beaches - Top Tips, Advice & Information

places.name: Praia do Barranco das Belharucas

reviews.text: Lovely sandy beach, very clean and well kept. Beach runs for several miles up to the port. Well worth a walk at sunset.
One of the most beautiful beaches i have ever been. If you're  in Algarve region this is a Must location for mind and soul.

The beach itself is great, the sand is soft for the most part and it's easy to get into.

The water is cold, as it's the Atlantic ocean. The waves can be high and the current can be strong, so watch out.

The main 2 issues we encountered were:

1- Even though we went during a weekday and arrived early, all the sunbeds were occupied or reserved, there were plenty of sunbeds that were reserved.

2- Would be nice to be able to get drinks/food and possibly service on the beach, there is 1 resort that is doing that, but only for its customers.

places.generalDescription: Praia Santa Eul√°lia is a stunning golden-sand beach located on the eastern side of town, offering a serene environment surrounded by lush vegetation and cliffs. It is known for its clear blue waters and picturesque sunrise views. The area around the beach features lifeguard services, restaurants, and easy access to seaside resorts and hotels. Nature enthusiasts can enjoy coastal walks with panoramic views while adventure seekers can partake in boat trips from this idyllic location.

sources.snippet: Praia Santa Eul√°lia, which is distinguished for being surrounded by lush vegetation and cliffs. It offers an ideal environment to enjoy the summer weather and the sun, but also to take part in adventurous excursions and to join the best boat trips in Albufeira, which also usually start from there. In Santa Eul√°lia nature enthusiasts will find a paradise and can embark on walks along the coastal paths that offer panoramic views and moments of serenity.
sources.shortName: Day Trips from Albufeira

sources.snippet: Without a doubt one of the best beaches in Albufeira, Praia Santa Eulalia is like a little slice of heaven. Here you can escape from the rest of the holidaymakers who are visiting the Algarve. On the eastern outskirts of town, the beach is blessed with soft, fine, golden sand that shimmers under the endless sun, and has plenty of rock formations to explore if you‚Äôre feeling a little adventurous.
sources.shortName: The secrets of Albufeira‚Äôs best beaches and bays

sources.snippet: There is another sea called the Praia the Santa Eulalia, which is well-known for its lovely condition and fantastic view. This beach is ideal for those who don‚Äôt want to get to the middle of the somewhat generic Albufeira town because it‚Äôs easily accessible by car. When people got there, they noticed that the water was clear and blue, and the sand covered the shoreline up to the water.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Best Albufeira Beaches for Your Seaside Getaway

sources.snippet: A lovely, sandy beach which is hugely popular with families. Located between Albufeira and Olhos De √Ågua, this glorious stretch of sand has been awarded a Blue Flag making it perfect for swimming and snorkelling. It is fairly sheltered by the ochre cliffs at either end and there is a restaurant, Restaurante Atlantico serving Portuguese flavours with a privileged view of the beach.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches Near Albufeira to Visit

sources.snippet: The last beach on my list is located 3 km (1.86 mi) east of the city centre. Praia de Santa Eul√°lia has fine light golden sand and calm water that makes it good for swimming. What makes Santa Eul√°lia one of Albufeira best beaches is that it‚Äôs surrounded by cliffs with lush pine gardens that can be admired from anywhere on the beach.
sources.shortName: 7 Most Beautiful & Best Beaches in Albufeira

sources.snippet: The Praia de Santa Eul√°lia is located a little over 4 km to the east of Albufeira. It is something of an upmarket resort beach as the meticulously landscaped gardens to the rear of the beach will tell you. You will find rows of palm trees interspersed with aloes and other exotic plants along with areas of neatly trimmed grassy lawn.
sources.shortName: 26 of the Best Beaches in Albufeira

sources.snippet: Immerse yourself in the charm of Santa Eul√°lia beach, a picturesque beach nestled east of Albufeira‚Äôs bustling center. Framed by golden cliffs and lush pine groves, Santa Eul√°lia offers a peaceful escape. Clear, azure waters lap at the soft sand, making it ideal for swimming, snorkeling, or simply soaking up the Algarve sunshine.
sources.shortName: 9 Best Beaches in Albufeira 2024 ‚Ä¢ Algarve Moments

sources.snippet: Praia de Santa Eul√°lia is a large bay just to the east of Praia da Oura with water sports, sun beds, parasols and restaurants. There is a car park (with allocated parking bays for disabled drivers) at the beach, which is just over 4 km from the centre of Albufeira. Praia da Balaia is the eastern end of Santa Eul√°lia.
sources.siteName: Portugal Visitor Travel Guide To Portugal
sources.shortName: Albufeira Beaches

sources.snippet: Surrounded by cliffs with palm and pine trees, this is one of the greenest and most beautiful beaches in the area. It‚Äôs clean and child-friendly, and has a restaurant serving fresh fish. There are also some great hotels with direct access, making it one of the best beaches for a relaxing holiday in Albufeira.
sources.shortName: Top 20 ALBUFEIRA BEACHES - The Best and Most Beautiful 2024

sources.snippet: Praia de Santa Eul√°lia is one of the greenest beaches in the area. Backed by a combination of pine gardens and rock formations, this beach will surely impress you. Also this beach is located a couple of kilometres outside the town of Albufeira, which makes it less crowded than many other Albufeira beaches.
sources.shortName: Albufeira Beaches You Should Visit During Your Holiday [Updated]

sources.snippet: Praia St Eulalia is a very scenic beach located a few kilometers east of Albufeira center, in the Santa Eulalia area. The beach is easily accessible by car/taxi and has convenient parking. In the high season, you will find all kinds of water sports here.
sources.shortName: 9 BEST Beaches in Albufeira (+Map, Photos & Insider Tips)

sources.snippet: Praia Santa Eul√°lia and Praia da Balaia are two beaches located in a quiet part of Albufeira. There is a large luxury hotel on the beach, but otherwise it is not that busy. This is another beautiful beach with impressive rocks.
sources.shortName: The most beautiful beaches in Albufeira

places.name: Praia Santa Eul√°lia

reviews.text: Great beach only a 7 min bus ride from real belavista hotel. Intimate area not crowded. Very clean and tidy. Beautiful sand and the calm ocean waves were mesmerising. Resteraunts serving lunch and drinks on top of the cliffs.

Easy Sandy Beach
Not to many people before summer season
Good for families water is calm and not deep

We did a 9 mm trek over to the beach from Vila Petra resort at the northern end of The Strip.  It is too cool for beach activities but ideal for walking the beaches and cliff trails back to The Strip.
Lots of folks had the same idea so there was a few times when we could just enjoy the scenery and wild flowers while we waited for them to pass on the narrow trail.

places.generalDescription: Praia dos Salgados is a stunning stretch of white-sand beach located at the western end of Albufeira. It is known for its tranquility, spaciousness, and natural beauty. The beach offers opportunities for long walks along the sea, with the option to continue on to other nearby beaches. Families and visitors to the golf resort frequent this area, where sunbeds and umbrellas are available for rent.
places.name: Praia dos Salgados

reviews.text: Great beach, not too busy, has loads of folk walking along the shoreline. Fab sand, not too coarse like some. Fab waves! Felt a bit string for the current though, I wouldn't go too deep. Great for a relaxing afternoon. Very clean.

Gorgeous vast beach ! Really nice bar/restaurant on the beach. If visiting in the summer a table must be booked as it gets so busy it's impossible to get a place. Seafood fantastic and their coconut pudding it's a treat.

Stunning beach with beautiful coves and soft sand- you can walk for miles and miles and can cut off when tide is in as there is a lovely walkway to continue the walk . Very well set up and only seen this in Jersey from all my travels - beach walkers dream

places.generalDescription: Praia da Oura, located near Albufeira, is a popular beach known for its lively atmosphere. It's a favorite among young tourists due to its proximity to bustling bars and restaurants in Albufeira. Families can also enjoy the beach during the day. The wide golden sand beach features stunning rock formations with autumnal colors and is monitored by lifeguards in the summer. Visitors can explore caves and coves, but should be cautious of strong currents in these areas.

sources.snippet: If you‚Äôre based in Albufeira and are looking for a beach that‚Äôs significantly livelier than Praia dos Aveiros, neighbouring Praia da Oura is a prime pick Ã∂ it‚Äôs a perpetually popular evening excursion amongst young tourists because of its close proximity to Albufeira‚Äôs bustling bars and restaurants, but also suitable for families who want to have fun here during the day. A wide sweeping beach with gold sand and rock formations in awe-inspiring autumnal colours, Praia da Oura is monitored by lifeguards during the summer, the water is reasonably warm and pleasant and there are caves and coves to explore, although please be careful as the currents can be strong in these areas. If you want a lively beach that‚Äôs close to the hip strip, this is it.
sources.shortName: 10 of the best beaches in the Algarve

sources.snippet: Located east of the old town in the Areias de S√£o Jo√£o neighbourhood, this beach predominately services the busy Oura area of Albufeira that is home to the main bars and clubs on The Strip. Surrounded by the beautiful rock formations and spanning, just short of a kilometre of golden sand, this beach usually attracts the younger crowd, making it famous for teenagers, stag and hen parties in Albufeira. This is also one of the best beaches in the Albufeira area to experience water sports given the enormous choice.
sources.shortName: Best Albufeira Beaches - Top Tips, Advice & Information

sources.snippet: Located to the east of Albufeira, Praia da Oura is popular with young people and families. It has a lively atmosphere and is lined with bars, restaurants, and water sports facilities including jet skiing, parasailing and a banana boat ride for the ultimate adrenaline rush!. It has been awarded a Blue Flag by the EU for cleanliness and safety and, whilst it can get busy in the summer, it is a good choice for those wanting to be close to facilities and nightlife when the sun goes down.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches Near Albufeira to Visit

sources.snippet: Considered one of the best beaches near Albufeira, Praia da Oura offers excellent facilities, including access for people with reduced mobility, making it accessible to all visitors. The area around the beach is filled with bars and restaurants, providing leisure and dining options to suit all tastes. During the summer, it is a hub of tourist activity in Albufeira, known for its festive events and vibrant nightlife.
sources.shortName: The 7 best beaches in Albufeira, the Algarve

sources.snippet: Situated at the bottom of a steep hill in front of the resort village of Oura, is one of Albufeira's best beaches. A long sweep of golden sand backed by a promenade lined with cafes, bars and some nice restaurants the beach here is a little more laid back than those closer to Albufeira town. The beach itself stretches all the way to neighbouring Praia dos Olhos d‚ÄôAgua, about 2km (1.3 miles) when the tide is out.
sources.shortName: 26 of the Best Beaches in Albufeira

sources.snippet: Praia da Oura is east of Peneco and Pescadores past the two small beaches of Praia do Inatel and Praia dos Alem√£es. A small, sheltered cove, Praia da Oura is close to "The Strip" of bars and restaurants and a number of resort hotels. Praia da Oura is best reached by a Blue Line (Azul) or Green Line (Verde) Giro bus from the top of the escalator in Albufeira town.
sources.siteName: Portugal Visitor Travel Guide To Portugal
sources.shortName: Albufeira Beaches

sources.snippet: Praia da Oura" means "Golden Beach" and, if you don't find precious metal there, you can find a certain golden youth, as well as many families. It is a young and rather trendy beach, probably the most popular in Albufeira. The rows of bars, shops and various temptations attract a public for whom contemplation and solitude do not seem to be the priorities.
sources.shortName: The beaches around Albufeira

sources.snippet: The Praia da Oura beach is the more active of the two if you want to go somewhere with something like that. This beach is because of the gorgeous views and fun activities. It is on the stunning Algarve coast, unspoilt by mass tourism, with developed beaches and easy access to the sea for water sports enthusiasts.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Best Albufeira Beaches for Your Seaside Getaway

sources.snippet: Praia da Oura is situated a short distance to the east of Albufeira old town. It is not as large as Albufeira‚Äôs main beach but boasts just as many bars and cafes along its strip. Oura is the perfect choice for a group who want to stay in Albufeira but want a bit more of a relaxing beach experience.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches in Albufeira, Algarve - Hidden Gems & Must-Visit Spots

sources.snippet: Albufeira‚Äôs ‚Äúparty beach‚Äù is a 5-minute walk from ‚ÄúThe Strip,‚Äù the town‚Äôs nightlife district. It‚Äôs the beach where young people spend their day before a night out at the bars. It offers parasols, loungers, boats and watersports equipment for rent, and is overlooked by a restaurant.
sources.shortName: Top 20 ALBUFEIRA BEACHES - The Best and Most Beautiful 2024

sources.snippet: It is situated close to the centre of Albufeira, adding to its appeal. It is in quite a busy area, so it has plenty of restaurants and cafes nearby for you to enjoy some lunch while spending the day at the beach. The beach is popular amongst young people due to its night scene.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches in Albufeira

sources.snippet: Located in the heart of the new town, Praia da Oura is one of the most popular beaches in Albufeira. It‚Äôs known for its lively atmosphere and golden sands (thus the name which literally means ‚ÄòGolden Beach‚Äô). This is one of the best Albufeira beaches that truly has it all.
sources.shortName: 9 BEST Beaches in Albufeira (+Map, Photos & Insider Tips)

sources.snippet: Nearby you can find a crazy nightlife scene, which lasts until early morning. The beach is mainly visited by young people, who like to tan during the day and go out at night. If you like to party, come and explore this beach.
sources.shortName: Albufeira Beaches You Should Visit During Your Holiday [Updated]

sources.snippet: Praia da Oura beach is at the end of Albufeira‚Äôs infamous bar strip. It can get a little crowded here (there are many sunbeds ready for you), but it still is a beautiful beach with large rocks.
sources.shortName: The most beautiful beaches in Albufeira

sources.snippet: Praia da Oura: is the largest beach of Albufeira and it is boarded by cliffs. Unfortunately it is always very crowded.
sources.shortName: Albufeira: beaches, things to do and recommended hotels
Beaches in Albufeira

places.name: Praia da Oura

reviews.text: Beautiful Beach and the surrounding rock formations are stunning, great location to get some nice pictures mixed in with the water, there's a lovely bird spot nearby and multiple routes to the beach and running along the beach. Would recommend to anyone nearby at least taking the stroll down beach/rocks.
The beach is absolutely beautiful, with crystal-clear water and stunning views. There are many great spots to take amazing photos, especially at sunset. A perfect place to relax and enjoy nature!

This was my favourite beach such beautiful views and relaxing vibes.
Great for sun bathing and a swim handy for the cafe and restaurants for food and drink.
Loved it üòç

places.generalDescription: Praia dos Alem√£es is a stunning stretch of sandy beach that offers visitors a perfect blend of relaxation and natural beauty. Nestled along the coast, this beach features sun loungers and parasols available for hire, making it an ideal spot to soak up the sun. The backdrop of clifftop bars adds to its charm, providing refreshing drinks and snacks just steps away from the shore.

sources.snippet: To the west of Albufeira‚Äôs old town you‚Äôll find Praia dos Alem√£es. This long, Blue Flag-rated beach is one of the less developed main beaches in Albufeira, but it can still get crowded. It‚Äôs particularly popular with families thanks to a floating inflatable playground, while there‚Äôs a seasonal lifeguard on duty during summer months.
sources.shortName: The Most Beautiful Beaches In Or Near Albufeira Portugal

sources.snippet: There are also beaches in the town itself ‚Äì Pescadores, T√∫nel, Alem√£es and Inatel ‚Äì easily accessible a short walk away. And the beaches continue to the east, rivalling each other in beauty and liveliness - Oura, Santa Eul√°lia, Maria Luisa and Olhos de √Ågua, which has freshwater springs right on the beach. The boundary of the municipality is marked by the long sandy Fal√©sia Beach - miles of beach edged by the cliffs that give it its name, that tumble in golden, coppery and red hues.
sources.shortName: Albufeira and the beaches | www.visitportugal.com

sources.snippet: The easternmost beach in central Albufeira‚Äôs long stretch of sand is quieter and less developed, but still has a couple of beachfront restaurants and hotels. In the summer, there are parasols and loungers for rent. It might be called ‚ÄúGermans Beach‚Äù (due to a German-owned fish canning factory that once existed above it), but it‚Äôs mostly frequented by British and Dutch tourists.
sources.shortName: Top 20 ALBUFEIRA BEACHES - The Best and Most Beautiful 2024

sources.snippet: Praia dos Alem√£es (German beach) is part of the long stretch of golden sand that takes in all of Albufeira's main town beaches. Don't read too much into the name as you are equally likely to see British or Dutch beachgoers as you are German. The name actually comes from an old fish canning factory located nearby which was owned by a German family.
sources.shortName: 26 of the Best Beaches in Albufeira

sources.snippet: If you walk east from Praia do T√∫nel, you will end up at Praia dos Alem√£es at the very end. As far as I am concerned, this is one of the nicer beaches in Albufeira. Few buildings, beautiful rocks and you can find a lot of beautiful shells here.
sources.shortName: The most beautiful beaches in Albufeira

sources.snippet: Praia dos Alem√£es is one the most eastern one of the urban beaches near Albufeira town. Even though the beach is very popular in summer months, it is slightly less crowded than on the other Albufeira town beaches. Read more about this beach
sources.shortName: Albufeira Beaches You Should Visit During Your Holiday [Updated]

sources.snippet: Praia dos Alem√£es is located in Albufeira and is another example of the paradisiacal beaches that exist in the Algarve. The huge golden sand allows children (and not only) to play beach soccer or rackets without other people being bothered.
sources.shortName: Top 25 most beautiful beaches in Algarve, Portugal

places.name: Praia dos Alem√£es

reviews.text: Beautiful clean beach. Very long and has a few bars/restaurants scattered along it. You can walk all the way to old town via the a beach. Golden sand. A few shells near the shore. Get a great view of the sunset from the beach. Cliffs along the side which you can access.

What's not to like about a stunning beach. Long, golden sands, fringing the Atlantic Ocean. The beach does get busy, but there is always a spot to sit. Sunbeds and umbrellas are available at a cost of 10 euros for the day. I love walking along this beach and heading through the tunnel to the old town or up the glass lift to get amazing views, day or night

Good beach,  climed the beautiful rocks but had troubles getting back down, so be aware!
Clean soft sand,  refreshing swim even tho its July . There are rubbish bins,  but not many toilet facilitys  . Also saw no shower to rinse off sand .

places.address: Forte de S√£o Jo√£o Aldeamento M√≥nica Isabel Beach Club, Beco do Forte de S√£o Jo√£o 313, Portugal

places.generalDescription: Praia do Castelo is a charming beach located near the village resort of Sesmarias. Despite its name, there are no castles nearby today. The beach is known for its clear waters, golden sands, and rocky surroundings. In the 16th century, a watchtower protected the coast in this area, giving rise to the beach's name. During summer, lifeguards ensure safety for swimmers and snorkelers who are drawn to the crystal-clear waters.

sources.snippet: The name of this beach near the village resort of Sesmarias might translate as ‚ÄúCastle Beach‚Äù but there‚Äôs no castles nearby today ‚Äì rather, the name comes from a long-gone watchtower that protected Albufeira‚Äôs coast in the 16th century and a large rock formation on the east side of the beach that resembles a castle. The crystal-clear waters are watched over by lifeguards in the summer making it a popular spot for swimming and snorkelling. There‚Äôs also a small beachside restaurant, Restaurante Pic-Nic, serving up fresh seafood and sandwiches.
sources.shortName: The Most Beautiful Beaches In Or Near Albufeira Portugal

sources.snippet: No one knows exactly how this beach got its name (‚ÄúCastle Beach‚Äù), but it may have derived from a rock formation or a 16th-century watchtower that‚Äôs now in ruins. It‚Äôs a very picturesque beach, sheltered by ocher cliffs and rocks, and is just 15 minutes from the center of Albufeira. Where to Stay: Vila Gale Collection Praia
sources.shortName: Top 20 ALBUFEIRA BEACHES - The Best and Most Beautiful 2024

sources.snippet: Yet another gorgeous beach located on the west of Albufeira‚Äôs Old Town. In fact, Praia do Castelo is right next to Praia da Coelha. This beach is surrounded by cliffs and has a wide stretch of thick golden sand, rocks covered with seaweed, and incredible crystal-clear bright green-blue water.
sources.shortName: 7 Most Beautiful & Best Beaches in Albufeira

sources.snippet: The beach is bordered by two large rock walls that shelter it from the wind. On the eastern side there is a rock formation that resembles the battlements of a castle, hence its name. Our fantastic  Gal√© Mar apartment is just a 15-minute walk from this magnificent beach.
sources.shortName: Top 5 beaches in Albufeira

sources.snippet: Praia do Castelo is a small beach a couple of kilometres west of Albufeira town. There are many hidden coves to discover around this beach. Moreover, you can go for a wonderful cliff walk and admire the natural surroundings of the beach.
sources.shortName: Albufeira Beaches You Should Visit During Your Holiday [Updated]

sources.snippet: Praia do Castelo is a bit of a hidden gem located about 6 kilometers west of Albufeira. This secluded beach is surrounded by steep cliffs and offers breathtaking views of the Atlantic Ocean. It‚Äôs truly very beautiful.
sources.shortName: 9 BEST Beaches in Albufeira (+Map, Photos & Insider Tips)
Beaches in Albufeira

places.name: Praia do Castelo

reviews.text: Beautiful Cove beach, clean & sandy with flight of wooden steps down to small restaurant and the beach. I visited in April 2025 and it was extremely quiet, but think it could get busy in high season.

A small but charming beach that's not overcrowded, which we really appreciated. Access is fairly easy if you're fit ‚Äì there are a few stairs and a slight incline, so it might be a bit tricky for elderly visitors who aren't steady on their feet. But for younger people or anyone in good shape, it's no problem at all.

There's also a small beach bar/restaurant where you can grab drinks, ice cream, or even have lunch, which is a nice bonus.

We had a really lovely day here. The only downside is that the rock formations surrounding the beach create a sort of natural tunnel, which blocks a lot of the breeze. On very hot days, the heat can build up and feel a bit intense.

Overall, a great spot for a relaxed beach day.
A very beautifull beach with nice waves to swim in and there are free parasols to use and it was nog that crowded so you had enough space

places.address: R. da Torre Velha 2, Albufeira, Portugal

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the charming village of Olhos de √Ågua, Praia dos Olhos de √Ågua is a delightful beach that captures the essence of coastal beauty. This serene spot boasts soft pale yellow sands and tranquil blue waters, making it perfect for sunbathing and swimming. The beach gets its unique name from the freshwater springs that emerge at low tide, creating a captivating natural spectacle. Families will love exploring the nearby limestone cliffs teeming with marine life, adding an adventurous touch to your visit.

sources.snippet: Praia dos Olhos de √Ågua is a picturesque little beach located just a short drive from Albufeira. Olhos de √Ågua is almost like a separate village within the municipality of Albufeira, with its own little center where you will find quite many restaurants and hotels. It‚Äôs much more ‚Äòseasonal‚Äô than Albufeira ‚Äì extremely busy in the summer and very quiet in the low season.
sources.shortName: 9 BEST Beaches in Albufeira (+Map, Photos & Insider Tips)

sources.snippet: It is an example of the old Portugal before the tourists show up. Fisherman tend their nets and boats right on the beach and you can really see how the world revolved around the sea in the Algarve before the hotels. This quaint beach would be perfect for a hen do wanting a break from the party and some time by the sea without the crowds.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches in Albufeira, Algarve - Hidden Gems & Must-Visit Spots

sources.snippet: Nestled in Albufeira, Portugal, Olhos de √Ågua Beach offers a charming escape. This relatively small beach boasts golden sands and calm waters, perfect for a relaxing day. But its true wonder lies beneath the surface.
sources.shortName: 9 Best Beaches in Albufeira 2024 ‚Ä¢ Algarve Moments
Beaches in Albufeira

places.name: Beach Olhos de √Ågua

reviews.text: Great little beach. Perfect for families, couples, dog walkers. Beautiful scenery and plenty of nice bars and eateries nearby

Such a brilliant place. Feels like you're off the beaten path but this beach is well covered with eateries and souvenir shops. Visited in April so my experience is that it wasn't too busy. Water was a good temperature too!

I'm from Oporto on the north and I come every year to Olhos D'√Ågua as it is a lovely beach, in low tide you can pass the rocks to Fal√©sia beach or go west to Maria Luisa, enjoying some walk as ODA beach is very small and cosy.
The beach concession is run by lovely Sandra and you can enjoy comfort and shadow at really competitive prices.

places.generalDescription: Praia da Coelha, also known as Rabbit Beach, is a stunning and secluded cove located about 6 km west of Albufeira Old Town. This small sandy beach is surrounded by yellow cliffs and offers fine golden sand with seashells and clear turquoise waters. Accessible via a footpath through bamboo, olive groves, and carob trees, the beach remains relatively uncrowded even during peak summer months.

sources.snippet: If you‚Äôre looking for a quieter, more secluded beach near Albufeira, head to Praia da Coelha, located between Albufeira and Arma√ß√£o de P√™ra. This pretty cove is only accessible via a footpath through bamboo, olive groves and carob trees that leads to timber steps, which makes access slightly tricky and keeps crowds away even in peak summer months. The beach is surrounded by large cliffs that protect the beach from wind ‚Äì but remember not to sit directly beneath the rocks as it can be dangerous.
sources.shortName: The Most Beautiful Beaches In Or Near Albufeira Portugal

sources.snippet: Located around 6 km (3.7 mi) west of Albufeira Old Town, Rabbit Beach is a breathtaking beach surrounded by yellow cliffs with fine golden sand with seashells and crystal-clear blue water. The beach is a 10-minute walk from the parking lot and has calm water, extraordinary rock formations and very picturesque scenery. Raised wooden walkways take you to the western part of the beach from where, along the water‚Äôs edge, you can reach the sections of Praia da Coelha that are more secluded and quiet.
sources.shortName: 7 Most Beautiful & Best Beaches in Albufeira

sources.snippet: This blue flag beach is just a short drive (or long walk) from Albufeira. The slight distance from the buzzing centre of town makes it one of the most serene Albufeira beaches, a notion that‚Äôs only confirmed when you take in the scenic views from the shore. There‚Äôs a car park so it‚Äôs easy to come here on four wheels, and even the tarmac is aesthetically pleasing to pass through as it‚Äôs lined by olive, carob, and bamboo trees.
sources.shortName: The secrets of Albufeira‚Äôs best beaches and bays

sources.snippet: Praia da Coelha is not extensive, but it is a perfect spot for those wanting to free themselves of disturbance and crowds. It is well tucked from the prominent mountain ridges and strong winds by cliffs and excellent foliage greens. As a barren piece of land not close to populated areas, Praia da Coelha has the potential to provide its visitors with peace of mind and an overdose of natural scenery.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Best Albufeira Beaches for Your Seaside Getaway

sources.snippet: It is known for its natural beauty, surrounded by cliffs and rock formations. It has hidden coves to explore and the large rock formations protect the beach from wind, keeping the water calm. The rocks also make it great for snorkelling, so if you are a keen snorkeler, this beach is a good choice that will showcase plenty of wildlife.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches in Albufeira

sources.snippet: Hidden between golden cliffs, this relatively small beach attracts young locals and tourists. Although it has become popular, it‚Äôs never as crowded as those in the center of town. It‚Äôs about 5km (3 miles) to the west and is worth finding, as it‚Äôs surrounded by pristine nature, which makes it one of the most beautiful in the region.
sources.shortName: Top 20 ALBUFEIRA BEACHES - The Best and Most Beautiful 2024

sources.snippet: This beach, located on the southern coast of the Algarve, is famous for its golden sand, crystal clear waters and rock formations that emerge from the ocean. Praia da Coelha is also one of Albufeira's most famous seaside resorts, mainly because of its central location. In addition, there are many water activities available here.
sources.shortName: Day Trips from Albufeira

sources.snippet: Located on the lovely stretch of coast between Albufeira and Arma√ß√£o de Pera is the charming little Praia da Coelha. Translated this means "Rabbit beach" although the only rabbit of any note here is the one on the sign. To get to the beach involves a short walk along a footpath through assorted greenery.
sources.shortName: 26 of the Best Beaches in Albufeira

sources.snippet: A tiny cove with a perfectly shaped bay, making it exceptionally sheltered. On the west side of the beach there is a unique natural arch in the rocks which has become quite iconic. There is a good restaurant here, Praia da Coelha, but, as it is the only one, we recommend booking ahead!
sources.shortName: Best Beaches Near Albufeira to Visit

sources.snippet: Its crystalline waters and the protection provided by the rocks of the wind make this beach quite competitive. There is a restaurant with terrace on the beach. The beach has a shower and sun loungers and parasols can be hired.
sources.shortName: Top 5 beaches in Albufeira

sources.snippet: Praia da Coelha is a small beach a couple of kilometres west of the town of Albufeira. The beach has some hidden coves and is great for collecting shells. Less crowded than the urban beaches in Albufeira.
sources.shortName: Albufeira Beaches You Should Visit During Your Holiday [Updated]

sources.snippet: Enjoy a relaxing day at the beach sunbathing or diving between submerged rocky formations in Praia de S√£o Rafael Beach.

places.name: Praia da Coelha

reviews.text:
Amazing beach !
Go at low tide and you can pass right through the cave on right end
Don't miss the the cave beside restaurant with hole in roof
Walk to left of beach and discover amazing views and more caves !
The beach is so beautiful! The sand is quite deep and the waves come in pretty close - but we loved it!

Very pretty beach located in the Albufeira area surrounded by stunning rock formations. There is a five minute walk in order to access the beach from the parking area. It is somewhat spacious but it fills up pretty quickly as it is a popular spot. Golden thick sand and crystal clear wavy waters. Highly recommend it :)

places.generalDescription: Restaurante da Praia de S√£o Rafael is located in a scenic and secluded area near Albufeira, offering a tranquil beach experience surrounded by steep cliffs and rock formations. The neighborhood boasts beautiful hotels and easy access to some of the most stunning beaches in the Algarve, including Praia da Sao Rafael and Praia dos Arrifes.

sources.snippet: Praia de Sao Rafael is an authentic delicatessen for visitors seeking a quiet and hidden beach away from the noisy city. This is why Sao Rafael is famous for snorkelling and diving since there is an enormous variety of sea creatures. Swimming in the crystal clear sea water, one can become becomeated by dolphins, sea turtles and brightly coloredcolouredFor those desiring more excitement, entertaining boat rides and marine activities can spend an entire day.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Best Albufeira Beaches for Your Seaside Getaway

sources.snippet: Praia de S√£o Rafael is known for its turquoise waters and unique rock formations, which create an ideal setting for an aquatic adventure. It is usually the starting point for the best boat trips in Albufeira and an ideal platform to discover the sunset. Booking a boat trip in Albufeira gives you the opportunity to admire up close the rock formations that rise from the sea and surround this beach.
sources.shortName: Day Trips from Albufeira

sources.snippet: Known for its clear waters and rock formations, this beach is located to the west of Albufeira and is a popular spot for snorkelling and diving. It is fairly sheltered which makes it a great choice for families. As it is further from the main town, it is more peaceful than some of the other beaches.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches Near Albufeira to Visit

sources.snippet: Enjoy a relaxing day at the beach sunbathing or diving between submerged rocky formations in Praia de S√£o Rafael Beach.
sources.shortName: Beaches in Albufeira

places.name: Restaurante da Praia de S√£o Rafael

reviews.text: Great spot right on the beach !! Just one very crucial and tourist friend detail missing, staff should serve drinks and food from restaurants on the lazy chairs and umbrella that they charge rent for instead of make you go there order and pickup food. Great way for servers make so e tips....

Was very busy but got a seat for 2 in 5-10 minutes. Right by the sea. Service initially was very quick to take drink orders and come out but shit the food was slow, 2 tables sat down way after us got ate and left before we had ours. Just for fried fish? One of the other tables even ordered the same dish as us and got it before. Waited 40 minutes we asked. Come asked food promptly came out. Not one to make a fuss, everyone was super nice and having worked in the industry for along time I understand these things happen!
Sangria (red):
Calamari: this was very good, thick batter with a very  egg fresh and tasty calamari. The garlic and herb mayo was incredible, strong garlic flavours super smooth mayo. Perfect combination with the calamari!
Shrimp risotto:
Meat and chroizo skewer: meat was well cooked, tender pink in the middle and full of flavour. I personally love roasted veg and these were nicely done

Don't waste your time in this restaurant. Unless you're feeling like loosing money and time for low quality, and overpriced food, this place is definitely not worth it. The 19,50‚Ç¨ Caesar salad looked and tasted like it has been directly store bought and plated. Even the shrimps weren't even that fresh. When we first got there not only it took them 40 minutes to give us a table, they also actively ignored our table. After a while when the server finally came we ordered a bottle of water with four glasses. The water came 30min later after we had already finished our meals. Even after calling over different servers, it took them this long to bring over a single bottle of water. If I could put 0 starts I would. The view of the beach is not worth this bad of an experience. Tourists, please don't do the same mistake I did prices are not supposed to be that high whatsoever. Thank you for your time

places.address: Praia de S√£o Rafael, 8200-613 Albufeira, Portugal

places.generalDescription: Praia da Gal√© (Oeste) is a hidden gem along the Algarve coast, offering miles of pristine sandy shores that are perfect for those seeking a tranquil escape. Located just a short drive from the bustling town of Albufeira, this beach provides an inviting atmosphere with fewer crowds compared to its neighboring beaches. Families will appreciate the convenient amenities available, including bars and shops, as well as options for water sports rentals.

sources.snippet: Combining miles of windswept sandy beaches, Praia da Gale, especially its long expanse, may be preferred by enthusiasts looking for a more laid-back experience. A relatively small beach, it is located only a few minute's drive from the crowded town of Albufeira and, therefore, it is much less crowded than many of the beaches in this region. A fun spot for families with children as well, Praia Gale boasts facilities like bars, shops, and outlets where water sports equipment can be hired.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Best Albufeira Beaches for Your Seaside Getaway

sources.snippet: Divided into two sections (east and west), this beach is popular with Portuguese families. It‚Äôs located outside the center of Albufeira, but also attracts tourists, as there are a number of hotels nearby, including one of the most luxurious in Algarve with one of the world‚Äôs top 50 restaurants. The access through ramps and the proximity of parking lots makes it a good choice for those with mobility issues.
sources.shortName: Top 20 ALBUFEIRA BEACHES - The Best and Most Beautiful 2024

sources.snippet: One of the few beaches that aren‚Äôt set inside the cliffs, Gal√© is a lovely long stretch of beach with Dunes and a fabulous selection of beach bars along with the 2 Michelin Star Boutique Hotel Vila Joyas‚Äô beach bar, foodies will be spoilt for choice. To the east, there are shallow pools, and unusual rock formations and the western area is more open.
sources.shortName: Best Albufeira Beaches - Top Tips, Advice & Information

sources.snippet: Set to the west of Albufeira and well known for its long stretch of golden sand and soft surf, this is a popular spot for families and water sports enthusiasts alike. The beach stretches all the way to Armacao de Pera and is another great choice for long beach walks. It is also quite accessible as there are no cliffs or steep drops to negotiate.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches Near Albufeira to Visit

sources.snippet: Praia da Gal√© is located a couple of kilometres west of Albufeira. However, compared to the crowded town beaches of the town, this beach has a remote feel to it. You will see plenty of rock formations in strange shapes and you can also find fossils in the rocks.
sources.shortName: Albufeira Beaches You Should Visit During Your Holiday [Updated]

sources.snippet: Head west from Albufeira and you will find some of the best beaches in Europe, let alone the Algarve. Praia da Gael is one of these. The beach can be broken into two halves, east and west.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches in Albufeira, Algarve - Hidden Gems & Must-Visit Spots

sources.snippet: The beach is about 6 km from the town centre and can be reached by EVA buses from the Albufeira Bus Station in Cali√ßos (20 minutes). Praia dos Salgados is the next long beach to the west.
sources.siteName: Portugal Visitor Travel Guide To Portugal
sources.shortName: Albufeira Beaches

places.name: Praia da Gal√© (Oeste)

reviews.text: Beautiful place, breathtaking views. Lovely bars‚Ä¶ good place to relax if you love beach.
One of the prettiest beaches I have been to. Take a look at the sunset we saw. Also loved that we could walk behind and have direct access from the hotel.

This beach is long and the sand is quite granular. In May, there were not a lot of Beach goers when we were there.

Parking is quite plentiful, there is a concession stand, and some cabanas for rent at ‚Ç¨10 a day on the west side.

It is not as exotic as some of the beaches near Benagil for the lack of huge boulders and giant caves.  However, this beach offers easier access and amenities.

Highly recommended.

places.address: Rua das Dunas, Guia Albufeira, 8200-424 Guia, Portugal

places.generalDescription: Praia da Rocha Baixinha Nascente is a stunning beach with wide sandy shores, surrounded by striking ocher rock formations and a picturesque pine forest teeming with wildlife. Visitors in mid-September 2018 were captivated by the expansive sandy stretch and the breathtaking views of pink-brown sandstone rocks sculpted by natural elements. The beach is ideal for leisurely strolls along the shore, offering great weather and mesmerizing ocean waves.

sources.snippet: Rocha Baixinha Poente (Tomato Beach) is described as a "young beach" because of its kitesurfing and surfing fans, but also its fiestas on the beach or at the local bar. While the population did seem young, we did not observe any surfing or fiestas which apparently go on very late. On the other hand, the wind is constant and the waves frequent, which is favourable to surfing, and therefore attracts young people.
sources.shortName: The beaches around Albufeira

sources.snippet: This beach is actually very close to Vilamoura, it‚Äôs a fairly big beach with golden and soft sand stretching over a kilometre. The beach offers a range of water-sports that will give you memories that you won‚Äôt forget. There aren‚Äôt many rocks on this beach, in fact the name translates to ‚Äòlow rock beach‚Äô because of the very low cliffs and lack of rocks.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches in Albufeira

places.name: Praia da Rocha Baixinha Nascente

reviews.text: The beach was totally empty as it was a bit windy and off season. The sea was cold but the sunset was breathtaking.

Our vacation was mid-September 2018. The beach is very wide, sandy. Before the eye, you can see the magnificent views of the pink-brown sandstone rocks, which are formated by rain, wind and ocean.
The beach is perfect for those who love long walks along the sea shore. We were very pleased with the great weather, ocean waves and beautiful Portugal.
Recommend to visit during March to May or September to October when it's still warm and there's not so many people

places.address: Estrada da Rocha Baixinha, 8200-409 Albufeira, Portugal

places.generalDescription: Praia dos Pescadores, also known as Fisherman's Beach, is a popular destination in Albufeira. This beach is divided by a cliff and features a concrete pier and an outdoor escalator. It offers various facilities, including easy access for people with reduced mobility. Families favor this beach due to its family-friendly atmosphere, while water sports enthusiasts can enjoy activities like jet skiing and sailing.

sources.snippet: Praia dos Pescadores runs directly in front of Albufeira‚Äôs old town and is one of the main beaches in the resort. While it might be tricky to find a patch of sand on the 225m (738ft) beach to claim in summer months, it does offer excellent convenience and accessibility ‚Äì there‚Äôs even an escalator from the Pau da Bandeira bluff down to the beach and old town. Praia dos Pescadores hasn‚Äôt always been crowded with tourists, though.
sources.shortName: The Most Beautiful Beaches In Or Near Albufeira Portugal

sources.snippet: Praia dos Pescadores offers a wide range of facilities, including easy access for those with reduced mobility. It is considered one of the best beaches in Albufeira for families, and water sports enthusiasts will find it an ideal spot for activities such as jet skiing and sailing. The history of Praia dos Pescadores is closely linked to the region‚Äôs fishing tradition, and it frequently hosts local festivals that celebrate this cultural heritage, attracting visitors from all over to take part in the celebrations.
sources.shortName: The 7 best beaches in Albufeira, the Algarve

sources.snippet: There are also beaches in the town itself ‚Äì Pescadores, T√∫nel, Alem√£es and Inatel ‚Äì easily accessible a short walk away. And the beaches continue to the east, rivalling each other in beauty and liveliness - Oura, Santa Eul√°lia, Maria Luisa and Olhos de √Ågua, which has freshwater springs right on the beach. The boundary of the municipality is marked by the long sandy Fal√©sia Beach - miles of beach edged by the cliffs that give it its name, that tumble in golden, coppery and red hues.
sources.shortName: Albufeira and the beaches | www.visitportugal.com

sources.snippet: The other major beach in Albufeira proper, Praia dos Pescadores ‚Äì or the Fisherman‚Äôs Beach ‚Äì runs along the eastern side of town and is unparalleled when it comes to amenities, space, and atmosphere. Originally where the fisherman of the village would operate from, the shoreline is now an expansive paradise of soft sand and lapping waves. There are plenty of facilities on the beach thanks to its prominent location.
sources.shortName: The secrets of Albufeira‚Äôs best beaches and bays

sources.snippet: Praia dos Pescadores (Fisherman's beach) is situated right in front of Albufeira's old town. It is one of the resort's main beaches along with neighbouring Praia do T√∫nel and as such can get pretty busy in the summer months. Of course there are advantages; it is easily accessible from the Old Town - there is even an escalator down to beach level from the cliffs behind.
sources.shortName: 26 of the Best Beaches in Albufeira

sources.snippet: Often a stage for live events, during the day and at night, in the summer and on New Year‚Äôs Eve, this is Albufeira‚Äôs liveliest beach. It‚Äôs right in the center of town, with sunshades and sunbeds, and plenty of places to eat and drink. Named after the fishermen who used to bring their boats here, it‚Äôs now mostly a beach for tourists who like the convenient location.
sources.shortName: Top 20 ALBUFEIRA BEACHES - The Best and Most Beautiful 2024

sources.snippet: If you want to get to know one of the beaches that best represents the spirit of Albufeira, then you cannot miss Praia dos Pescadores. This enclave will allow you to get a panoramic view of the ocean. You can take a dip in the turquoise waters and also learn about the Algarve's past as a fishing area, as the region's fishing boats are still anchored here today.
sources.shortName: Day Trips from Albufeira

sources.snippet: If you‚Äôre in the old town, this is the most accessible beach to get to by foot. Big enough to cope with the huge influx of visitors in the summer and small enough that you can see the end of it. It is, undoubtedly, the most popular beach in Albufeira because of its golden sand and the sea of ‚Äã‚Äãa dreamy blue.
sources.shortName: Best Albufeira Beaches - Top Tips, Advice & Information

sources.snippet: Praia dos Pescadores (Fisherman's Beach) is to the east of Praia do Peneco separated from it by a cliff. Praia dos Pescadores used to be where the local fishermen operated from but is now totally dedicated to tourism. The beach's facilities include two car parks, parasols, sun loungers, toilets and showers.
sources.siteName: Portugal Visitor Travel Guide To Portugal
sources.shortName: Albufeira Beaches

sources.snippet: Praia dos Pescadores, or Fisherman‚Äôs Beach, is probably the most popular in Albufeira. This beach is located right in the historic old town. Praia Peneco, also known as Praia do T√∫nel, is just nearby and is easily accessible via a pedestrian tunnel that leads you directly from the old town to the beach.
sources.shortName: 9 BEST Beaches in Albufeira (+Map, Photos & Insider Tips)

sources.snippet: This is the main beach in Albufeira and translates in English to 'Fisherman‚Äôs Beach'. Before the modern marina was built it was from this beach that local fisherman would head out on trips into the Atlantic. With a long expanse of golden sand, this is the hub of beach life in Albufeira.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches in Albufeira, Algarve - Hidden Gems & Must-Visit Spots

sources.snippet: Praia dos Pescadores is the other beach in front of the old town of Albufeira. There are usually a lot of people on the beach and therefore it is very lively, also at night. Make sure to check the view over this beach from the Pau da Bandeira viewpoint.
sources.shortName: Albufeira Beaches You Should Visit During Your Holiday [Updated]

sources.snippet: This is the main beach in Albufeira and is known for its golden sand and calm waters. It is located in the heart of the town and is surrounded by restaurants, bars, and shops. This is a very accessible beach with a lift and a tunnel through the cliffs.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches Near Albufeira to Visit

sources.snippet: There are two main beaches, that is to say Praia dos Pescadores and Praia do Tunel. Both are very clean, with crystalline waters and offering services like beachfront bars and restaurants.
sources.shortName: Albufeira: beaches, things to do and recommended hotels

sources.snippet: Visit this famous beach in Albufeira and have a walk on its promenade to the beautiful Xorino Grotto during your holidays.
sources.shortName: Beaches in Albufeira

places.name: Praia dos Pescadores

reviews.text:
Nice, clean beach in the old town.

There's a decent pier, water sports, beach volleyball, and inflatable obstacle course to enjoy while sunbathing there.

A great sandy beach accessible by an escalator from one side and a lift and staircase from the other. It's very long, so you can walk down to quieter areas of the beach. The sea is a beautiful blue colour and very clean, but not ideal for bodyboarding as there aren't many waves.

We spent New Year's Eve at Praia dos Pescadores for the incredible drone and fireworks show and wow, what an experience! Hundreds of drones lit up the sky in perfect sync with the music, followed by an amazing fireworks finale over the ocean. The atmosphere was magical, safe, and very family-friendly, even with thousands of people there. Everything felt well organized and relaxed. A few days later, the entire beach was spotless again, huge credit to the city for keeping it so clean. Truly a night to remember!

places.generalDescription: Praia Maria Lu√≠sa is a beautiful sandy beach located in the southern Algarve, easily accessible from the resort town of Olhos de Agua. Despite its seemingly secluded location, it can get quite busy due to the nearby Club Med da Balaia resort. The beach offers amenities such as umbrellas, sun loungers, and water sports equipment for hire. Visitors can also enjoy traditional dishes at the beachside restaurant with a shaded terrace.

sources.snippet: Located in the southern Algarve, this pretty stretch of sand can be easily reached by following a narrow footpath from the resort town of Olhos de √Ågua. While it might seem to be in a fairly secluded location, it‚Äôs often busy due to the Club Med da Balaia resort that sits on top of the red cliffs that surround the beach. The beach itself offers umbrellas, sun loungers and watersports equipment for hire, while there‚Äôs a beachside restaurant with a shaded terrace serving traditional dishes, such as grilled sardines and swordfish.
sources.shortName: The Most Beautiful Beaches In Or Near Albufeira Portugal

sources.snippet: And the beaches continue to the east, rivalling each other in beauty and liveliness - Oura, Santa Eul√°lia, Maria Luisa and Olhos de √Ågua, which has freshwater springs right on the beach. The boundary of the municipality is marked by the long sandy Fal√©sia Beach - miles of beach edged by the cliffs that give it its name, that tumble in golden, coppery and red hues. It‚Äôs an image that becomes more intense in the late afternoon light, one which will stay in your memory.
sources.shortName: Albufeira and the beaches | www.visitportugal.com

sources.snippet: Nestled by an ochre cliff, this beach is partly taken over by sunshades and sunbeds in the summer. It‚Äôs a favorite of Portuguese families and frequented by guests of the hotels in the area, who often rent pedal boats, jet skis and canoeing equipment. A scenic path over the cliff offers views of the beach and leads to the even more popular Praia de Olhos d‚Äô√Ågua.
sources.shortName: Top 20 ALBUFEIRA BEACHES - The Best and Most Beautiful 2024

places.name: Praia Maria Lu√≠sa

reviews.text: Nice small sandy beach with water spots facilities and beach bar / restaurant. You will need to have swimming shoes though as further into the water is a lot of little stones and it's hard to walk with bare feet.

Nice Sandy Beach that's good to walk,  swim,  lounge on. There's a post which is solid rock to walk on that's less visited and lovely.

There's a club med neighboring the beach.  I found parking too the right of the club med,  you can also drive your car al the way down the narrow landed road and grab one of the approximately 5-10 spots (depends if people park vertically to the fence or parallel as to how many spots are there). Also some parking next to the snack bar, /restaurant.
Beautiful beach, not crowded at the beginning of July. Limited parking opportunities. Definitely worth a visit if you are in the area.

places.address: R. da Praia M.¬™ Lu√≠sa, 8200-609 Albufeira, Portugal

places.generalDescription: Praia do Evaristo is a charming blue-flag beach with golden sands and seasonal lifeguards. It's a tiny cove near the village of Gale, known for its clear waters and secluded atmosphere, making it popular among Portugal's elite.

sources.snippet: This tiny cove near the village of Gal√© is popular with Portugal‚Äôs rich and famous ‚Äì not only because of its clear waters and secluded atmosphere, but also thanks to Evaristo Restaurant. This renowned eatery opened its doors in 1986 and is located directly on the beachfront. Its specialties include fresh fish, clams, tiger shrimp, scarlet shrimp, Squid Evaristo and lobster from the Algarve coast.
sources.shortName: The Most Beautiful Beaches In Or Near Albufeira Portugal

sources.snippet: The beach is unusual and known for its many rocks, thus making it overflow with sea life that you can explore and appreciate. There is a restaurant nearby on the beach that you can sit and enjoy your lunch before heading back to the beach. The rocks make the beach look beautiful and unique, it also gives plenty of places to explore both inside and outside the water.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches in Albufeira

sources.snippet: Once a secret, this beach became popular among Portuguese celebrities thanks to the restaurant that gave it its name. The restaurant is right on the sand, with large windows offering sea views. More views of the rocky bay can be admired from a path on one of the low ochre cliffs.
sources.shortName: Top 20 ALBUFEIRA BEACHES - The Best and Most Beautiful 2024

sources.snippet: Praia do Evaristo is a beach a couple of kilometres west of Albufeira. It has plenty of rocks and hidden coves, which are fun to discover. In summer, this beach is often visited by famous Portuguese people.
sources.shortName: Albufeira Beaches You Should Visit During Your Holiday [Updated]

sources.snippet: Around the beach there are several paths to reach the top of the cliffs to enjoy the spectacular landscape. Our  Ponta Grande villa is only 5 minutes drive from this beach.
sources.shortName: Top 5 beaches in Albufeira
Beaches in Albufeira

places.name: Praia do Evaristo

reviews.text: Our favorite beach in the Algarve. Coastline is stunning and a great place to explore the rich formations. Always find interesting shells and rocks, even some urchins! Check the tide, always better when low IMO.

Quite cool little beach, it has rocks and a bit of sand for those that are not just about lying on the sand to catch sun. It also has a little beach bar that serves food and drinks, showers and paid sun loungers. Probably worth mentioning that it's better with higher tides, with low tide the little rocky pools are empty. Beware parking is not huge! All in all worth a visit.
The restaurant is gone, But life guard is still there. But no toilet facilities.

places.address: R. da Torre Velha, Albufeira, Portugal
